Structs/MapGestureHandlers.html#/s:10Map.name: onEnd
Structs/MapGestureHandlers.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Called when a gesture has ended. The second argument informs whether there will be a deceleration animation. Use onAnimationEnd to handle the animation end.

Structs/MapGestureHandlers.html#/s:10Map.name: onAnimationEnd
Structs/MapGestureHandlers.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Called when deceleration animations triggered due to a gesture have ended.

Structs/AnnotationClusterGestureContext..name: point
Structs/AnnotationClusterGestureContext..abstract: The location of gesture in Map view bounds.

Structs/AnnotationClusterGestureContext..name: expansionZoom
Structs/AnnotationClusterGestureContext..abstract: Minimal zoom under which the annotation cluster expands.

Structs/RasterArraySource/RasterDataLaye.name: layerId
Structs/RasterArraySource/RasterDataLaye.abstract: Identifier of the data layer fetched from tiles.

Structs/RasterArraySource/RasterDataLaye.name: bands
Structs/RasterArraySource/RasterDataLaye.abstract: An array of bands found in the data layer.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: url
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: tiles
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: bounds
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: minzoom
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: maxzoom
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: tileSize
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: attribution
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterLayers
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Contains the description of the raster data layers and the bands contained within the tiles.

Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.name: tileCacheBudget
Structs/RasterArraySource.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

Structs/RasterArraySource/RasterDataLaye.name: RasterDataLayer
Structs/RasterArraySource/RasterDataLaye.abstract: The description of the raster data layers and the bands contained within the tiles.

Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.name: options
Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Settings for the custom raster source, including a fetchTileFunction callback

Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.name: tileCacheBudget
Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.abstract: This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.name: init(from:)
Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Init from a decoder, note that the CustomRasterSourceOptions are not decodable and need to be set separately

Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.name: encode(to:)
Structs/CustomRasterSource.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Encode, note that options will not be included

Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.name: options
Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.abstract: Settings for the custom geometry, including a fetchTileFunction callback

Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.name: tileCacheBudget
Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.abstract: This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache.

Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.name: init(from:)
Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.abstract: Init from a decoder, note that the CustomGeometrySourceOptions are not decodable and need to be set separately

Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.name: encode(to:)
Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html#/s:10M.abstract: Encode, note that options will not be included

Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: mapLoaded
Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: The style has been fully loaded, and the map has rendered all visible tiles.

Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: mapLoadingError
Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An error that has occurred while loading the Map.

Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: styleLoaded
Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: The requested style has been fully loaded.

Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: styleDataLoaded
Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: The requested style data has been loaded.

Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: mapIdle
Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: The map has entered the idle state.

Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: styleImageRemoveUnused
Structs/MapEventType.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An image added to the style is no longer needed and can be removed.

Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: easeInOut
Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: An ease-in ease-out curve causes the animation to begin slowly, accelerate through the middle of its duration.

Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: easeIn
Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: An ease-in curve causes the animation to begin slowly, and then speed up as it progresses.

Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: easeOut
Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: An ease-out curve causes the animation to begin quickly, and then slow down as it completes.

Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: linear
Structs/TimingCurve.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: A linear animation curve causes an animation to occur evenly over its duration.

Structs/Slot.html#/s:10MapboxMaps4SlotV3.name: top
Structs/Slot.html#/s:10MapboxMaps4SlotV3.abstract: Above POI labels and behind Place and Transit labels

Structs/Slot.html.name: Slot
Structs/Slot.html.abstract: A pre-specified location in the style where layer will be added to

Structs/MapEventType.html.name: MapEventType
Structs/MapEventType.html.abstract: A shim that makes it possible to subscribe to MapboxMap and Snapshotter events via the old onNext and onEvery methods.

Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html.name: CustomGeometrySource
Structs/CustomGeometrySource.html.abstract: Describes a Custom Geometry Source to be used in the style

Structs/CustomRasterSource.html.name: CustomRasterSource
Structs/CustomRasterSource.html.abstract: Describes a Custom Raster Source to be used in the style.

Structs/AnnotationClusterGestureContext..name: AnnotationClusterGestureContext
Structs/AnnotationClusterGestureContext..abstract: A structure that defines additional information about map content gesture performed on annotations’ cluster.

Other%20Structs.html#/s:10MapboxMaps12Ar.name: ArrayBuilder
Other%20Structs.html#/s:10MapboxMaps12Ar.abstract: A result builder that creates array of homogenous elements.

Structs/MapGestureHandlers.html.name: MapGestureHandlers
Structs/MapGestureHandlers.html.abstract: Creates handlers that will be called when the map gestures such as Pan, Pinch, Rotate, Zoom and others happen.

Other%20Functions.html#/s:10MapboxMaps21.name: withViewportAnimation(_:body:completion:)
Other%20Functions.html#/s:10MapboxMaps21.abstract: Applies the animation to the map viewport.

Extensions/RequestInfo.html#/s:So14MBMRe.name: loadingMethod
Extensions/RequestInfo.html#/s:So14MBMRe.abstract: The loading methods for the resource request.

Extensions/SourceDataLoaded.html#/s:So19.name: loaded
Extensions/SourceDataLoaded.html#/s:So19.abstract: When the type of an event is SourceDataLoadedType.Tile, the loaded

Extensions/CumulativeRenderingStatistics.name: drawCalls
Extensions/CumulativeRenderingStatistics.abstract: The number of draw calls at the end of the collection window.

Extensions/CumulativeRenderingStatistics.name: textureBytes
Extensions/CumulativeRenderingStatistics.abstract: The amount of texture memory in use at the end of the collection window.

Extensions/CumulativeRenderingStatistics.name: vertexBytes
Extensions/CumulativeRenderingStatistics.abstract: The amount of vertex memory (array and index buffer memory) in use at the end of the collection window.

Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions/.name: cumulative
Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions/.abstract: Enables the collection of cumulativeValues, which are GPU resource statistics.

Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions/.name: perFrame
Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions/.abstract: Enables the collection of perFrameValues, which are CPU timeline duration statistics.

Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..name: samplerOptions
Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..abstract: Set of samplers to which define the following types of sampling: cumulative, per-frame, or boths.

Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..name: init(_:samplingDurationMillis:)
Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..abstract: Specify the types of sampling: cumulative, per-frame, or both and define the minimum elapsed time for collecting performance samples.

Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..name: init(_:)
Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..abstract: Specify the types of sampling: cumulative, per-frame, or both.

Extensions/AnyCancellable.html#/s:7Combi.name: store(in:)
Extensions/AnyCancellable.html#/s:7Combi.abstract: Stores this type-erasing cancellable instance in the specified set.

Extensions/AnyCancellable.html#/s:7Combi.name: store(in:)
Extensions/AnyCancellable.html#/s:7Combi.abstract: Stores this type-erasing cancellable instance in the specified collection.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10MapboxMapsS.name: all
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10MapboxMapsS.abstract: Creates an annotation configs list that allows anchor to be presented in all directions.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10MapboxMapsS.name: center
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10MapboxMapsS.abstract: Creates an anchor config that allow only center position for anchor, meaning there will be no anchor.

Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..name: PerformanceStatisticsOptions
Extensions/PerformanceStatisticsOptions..abstract: Options for the following statistics collection behaviors:

Enums/TileCacheBudgetSize.html#/s:10Mapb.name: tiles(_:)
Enums/TileCacheBudgetSize.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: A tile cache budget measured in tile units

Enums/TileCacheBudgetSize.html#/s:10Mapb.name: megabytes(_:)
Enums/TileCacheBudgetSize.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: A tile cache budget measured in megabyte units

Enums/TileCacheBudgetSize.html.name: TileCacheBudgetSize
Enums/TileCacheBudgetSize.html.abstract: Defines a TileCacheBudgetSize, which can be set as either a megabyte or tile count limit.

Structs/ForEvery.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8Fo.name: init(_:id:content:)
Structs/ForEvery.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8Fo.abstract: Creates instance that identified data by given key path.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: init(coordinate:content:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Creates a view annotation at geographical coordinate.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: init(layerId:featureId:content:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Creates a view annotation on feature rendered on a layer.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: allowOverlap(_:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: If true, the annotation will be visible even if it collides with other annotations. Defaults to false.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: allowHitTesting(_:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Configures whether this view participates in hit test operations. Defaults to true.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: allowOverlapWithPuck(_:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: When false, the annotation won’t be shown on top of Puck.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: ignoreCameraPadding(_:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: When false, the annotation will be displayed even if it go beyond camera padding.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: visible(_:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Specifies if this view annotation is visible or not. Defaults to true.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: selected(_:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Specifies if this view annotation is selected meaning it should be placed on top of others. Defaults to false.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: onVisibilityChanged(action:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Called when visibility of annotation is changed.

Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: onAnchorCoordinateChanged(action:)
Structs/MapViewAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Called when geographical coordinate of annotation anchor is changed.

Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.name: init(_:id:content:)
Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.abstract: Creates a group that identifies data by given key path.

Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.name: circleEmissiveStrength(_:)
Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.name: circlePitchAlignment(_:)
Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.abstract: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.name: circlePitchScale(_:)
Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.abstract: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.name: circleTranslate(_:)
Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.name: layerPosition(_:)
Structs/CircleAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10.abstract: Defines relative position of the layers drawing the annotations managed by the current group.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: init(_:id:content:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Creates a group that identifies data by given key path.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: init(_:content:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Creates a group from identifiable data.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: init(content:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Creates static group.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconAllowOverlap(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconIgnorePlacement(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconKeepUpright(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconOptional(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconPadding(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconPitchAlignment(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconRotationAlignment(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: symbolAvoidEdges(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: symbolPlacement(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Label placement relative to its geometry.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: symbolSpacing(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Distance between two symbol anchors.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: symbolZElevate(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Position symbol on buildings (both fill extrusions and models) rooftops. In order to have minimal impact on performance, this is supported only when fill-extrusion-height is not zoom-dependent and remains unchanged. For fading in buildings when zooming in, fill-extrusion-vertical-scale should be used and symbols would raise with building rooftops. Symbols are sorted by elevation, except in cases when viewport-y sorting or symbol-sort-key are applied.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: symbolZOrder(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use symbol-sort-key.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textAllowOverlap(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textFont(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Font stack to use for displaying text.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textIgnorePlacement(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textKeepUpright(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textMaxAngle(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Maximum angle change between adjacent characters.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textOptional(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textPadding(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textPitchAlignment(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textRotationAlignment(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textVariableAnchor(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: To increase the chance of placing high-priority labels on the map, you can provide an array of text-anchor locations: the renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving onto the next label. Use text-justify: auto to choose justification based on anchor position. To apply an offset, use the text-radial-offset or the two-dimensional text-offset.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textWritingMode(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesnâ€™t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconColorSaturation(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Controls saturation level of the symbol icon. With the default value of 1 the icon color is preserved while with a value of 0 it is fully desaturated and looks black and white.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconTranslate(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Distance that the icon’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: iconTranslateAnchor(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Controls the frame of reference for icon-translate.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textTranslate(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Distance that the text’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: textTranslateAnchor(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Controls the frame of reference for text-translate.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: slot(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Slot for the underlying layer.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: clusterOptions(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Defines point annotation clustering options.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: onClusterTapGesture(perform:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Adds a handler for tap gesture on annotations cluster.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: onClusterLongPressGesture(perform:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Adds a handler for long press gesture on annotation cluster formed by annotations from the group.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: layerPosition(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Defines relative position of the layers drawing the annotations managed by the current group.

Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.name: layerId(_:)
Structs/PointAnnotationGroup.html#/s:10M.abstract: Specifies identifier for underlying implementation layer.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: init(_:id:content:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: Creates a group that identifies data by given key path.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: lineMiterLimit(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: lineRoundLimit(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: lineDasharray(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with lineMetrics: true specified won’t render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: lineDepthOcclusionFactor(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: Decrease line layer opacity based on occlusion from 3D objects. Value 0 disables occlusion, value 1 means fully occluded.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: lineEmissiveStrength(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: lineTranslate(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: lineTrimOffset(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: The line part between [trim-start, trim-end] will be marked as transparent to make a route vanishing effect. The line trim-off offset is based on the whole line range [0.0, 1.0].

Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.name: layerPosition(_:)
Structs/PolylineAnnotationGroup.html#/s:.abstract: Defines relative position of the layers drawing the annotations managed by the current group.

Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.name: init(_:id:content:)
Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.abstract: Creates a group that identifies data by given key path.

Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.name: fillAntialias(_:)
Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.abstract: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.name: fillEmissiveStrength(_:)
Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.name: fillTranslate(_:)
Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.name: layerPosition(_:)
Structs/PolygonAnnotationGroup.html#/s:1.abstract: Defines relative position of the layers drawing the annotations managed by the current group.

Structs/Puck3D.html#/s:10MapboxMaps6Puck.name: modelRotation(_:)
Structs/Puck3D.html#/s:10MapboxMaps6Puck.abstract: The rotation of the model in euler angles [lon, lat, z].

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineDasharray
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with lineMetrics: true specified won’t render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineDepthOcclusionFactor

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineTranslate
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.name: lineTrimOffset
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html#/.abstract: The line part between [trim-start, trim-end] will be marked as transparent to make a route vanishing effect. The line trim-off offset is based on the whole line range [0.0, 1.0].

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: annotations
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: The collection of PointAnnotation being managed.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: delegate
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Set this delegate in order to be called back if a tap occurs on an annotation being managed by this manager.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: onClusterTap
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: onClusterLongPress
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconAllowOverlap
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconIgnorePlacement
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconKeepUpright
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconOptional
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconPadding
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconPitchAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconRotationAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: symbolAvoidEdges
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: symbolPlacement
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Label placement relative to its geometry.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: symbolSpacing
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Distance between two symbol anchors.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: symbolZElevate
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Position symbol on buildings (both fill extrusions and models) rooftops. In order to have minimal impact on performance, this is supported only when fill-extrusion-height is not zoom-dependent and remains unchanged. For fading in buildings when zooming in, fill-extrusion-vertical-scale should be used and symbols would raise with building rooftops. Symbols are sorted by elevation, except in cases when viewport-y sorting or symbol-sort-key are applied.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: symbolZOrder
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use symbol-sort-key.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textAllowOverlap
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textFont
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Font stack to use for displaying text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textIgnorePlacement
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textKeepUpright
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textMaxAngle
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Maximum angle change between adjacent characters.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textOptional
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textPadding
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textPitchAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textRotationAlignment
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textVariableAnchor
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: To increase the chance of placing high-priority labels on the map, you can provide an array of text-anchor locations: the renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving onto the next label. Use text-justify: auto to choose justification based on anchor position. To apply an offset, use the text-radial-offset or the two-dimensional text-offset.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textWritingMode
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesnâ€™t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconColorSaturation
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Controls saturation level of the symbol icon. With the default value of 1 the icon color is preserved while with a value of 0 it is fully desaturated and looks black and white.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconTranslate
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Distance that the icon’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconTranslateAnchor
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Controls the frame of reference for icon-translate.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textTranslate
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Distance that the text’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: textTranslateAnchor
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Controls the frame of reference for text-translate.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: slot
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Slot for the underlying layer.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconTextFit
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.name: iconTextFitPadding
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html#/s:1.abstract: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by icon-text-fit, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: id
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Identifier for this annotation

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: geometry
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The geometry backing this annotation

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: point
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The point backing this annotation

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: isSelected
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Toggles the annotation’s selection state.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: isDraggable
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Property to determine whether annotation can be manually moved around map

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: tapHandler
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Handles tap gesture on this annotation.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: longPressHandler
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Handles long press gesture on this annotation.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: dragBeginHandler
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The handler is invoked when the user begins to drag the annotation.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: dragChangeHandler
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The handler is invoked when annotation is being dragged.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: dragEndHandler
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The handler receives the annotation and the context parameters of the gesture:

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: customData
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: JSON convertible properties associated with the annotation, used to enrich Feature GeoJSON properties["custom_data"] field.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: userInfo
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Properties associated with the annotation.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: init(id:point:isSelected:isDraggable:)
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Create a point annotation with a Point and an optional identifier.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: init(id:coordinate:isSelected:isDraggable:)
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Create a point annotation with a coordinate and an optional identifier

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconAnchor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconImage
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconOffset
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of icon-size to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with icon-rotate the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconRotate
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Rotates the icon clockwise.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconSize
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by icon-size. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconTextFit
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconTextFitPadding
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by icon-text-fit, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: symbolSortKey
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with lower sort keys are drawn and placed first. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is false, features with a lower sort key will have priority during placement. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is set to true, features with a higher sort key will overlap over features with a lower sort key.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textAnchor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textField
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Value to use for a text label. If a plain string is provided, it will be treated as a formatted with default/inherited formatting options. SDF images are not supported in formatted text and will be ignored.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textJustify
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Text justification options.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textLetterSpacing
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Text tracking amount.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textLineHeight
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Text leading value for multi-line text.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textMaxWidth
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The maximum line width for text wrapping.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textOffset
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. If used with text-variable-anchor, input values will be taken as absolute values. Offsets along the x- and y-axis will be applied automatically based on the anchor position.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textRadialOffset
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Radial offset of text, in the direction of the symbol’s anchor. Useful in combination with text-variable-anchor, which defaults to using the two-dimensional text-offset if present.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textRotate
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Rotates the text clockwise.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textSize
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Font size.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textTransform
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS text-transform property.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The color of the icon. This can only be used with SDF icons.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconEmissiveStrength
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconHaloBlur
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Fade out the halo towards the outside.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconHaloColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The color of the icon’s halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconHaloWidth
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Distance of halo to the icon outline.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconImageCrossFade
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Controls the transition progress between the image variants of icon-image. Zero means the first variant is used, one is the second, and in between they are blended together.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: iconOpacity
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The color with which the text will be drawn.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textEmissiveStrength
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textHaloBlur
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The halo’s fadeout distance towards the outside.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textHaloColor
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The color of the text’s halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textHaloWidth
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is ¼ of the font-size.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: textOpacity
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The opacity at which the text will be drawn.

Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: image
Structs/PointAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The opacity of the circle’s stroke.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: circleStrokeWidth(_:)
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The width of the circle’s stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the circle-radius.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: onTapGesture(handler:)
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Adds a handler for tap gesture on current annotation.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: onTapGesture(handler:)
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Adds a handler for tap gesture on current annotation.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: onLongPressGesture(handler:)
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Adds a handler for long press gesture on current annotation.

Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: onLongPressGesture(handler:)
Structs/CircleAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Adds a handler for long press gesture on current annotation.

Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/s:10Ma.name: sourceId
Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: The id of the GeoJSONSource that this manager is responsible for.

Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/s:10Ma.name: layerId
Protocols/AnnotationManager.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: The id of the layer that this manager is responsible for.

Protocols/Annotation.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: geometry
Protocols/Annotation.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: The geometry that is backing this annotation.

Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..name: annotationManager(_:didDetectTappedAnnotations:)
Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..abstract: This method is invoked when a tap gesture is detected on an annotation

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.name: annotationManagersById
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.abstract: Dictionary of annotation managers keyed by their identifiers.

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.name: makePointAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:clusterOptions:onClusterTap:onClusterLongPress:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.abstract: Creates a PointAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.name: makePolygonAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.abstract: Creates a PolygonAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.name: makePolylineAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.abstract: Creates a PolylineAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.name: makeCircleAnnotationManager(id:layerPosition:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.abstract: Creates a CircleAnnotationManager which is used to manage a collection of

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.name: removeAnnotationManager(withId:)
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html#/s:1.abstract: Removes an annotation manager, this will remove the underlying layer and source from the style.

Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html.name: AnnotationOrchestrator
Classes/AnnotationOrchestrator.html.abstract: AnnotationOrchestrator provides a way to create annotation managers of different types.

Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..name: AnnotationInteractionDelegate
Protocols/AnnotationInteractionDelegate..abstract: A delegate that is called when a tap is detected on an annotation (or on several of them).

Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html.name: CircleAnnotationManager
Classes/CircleAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of CircleAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of CircleAnnotations.

Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html.name: PointAnnotationManager
Classes/PointAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of PointAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of PointAnnotations.

Classes/PolygonAnnotationManager.html.name: PolygonAnnotationManager
Classes/PolygonAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of PolygonAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of PolygonAnnotations.

Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html.name: PolylineAnnotationManager
Classes/PolylineAnnotationManager.html.abstract: An instance of PolylineAnnotationManager is responsible for a collection of PolylineAnnotations.

Structs/ClusterOptions.html.name: ClusterOptions
Structs/ClusterOptions.html.abstract: Options to configure point annotation clustering with PointAnnotationManager.

Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: diacriticSensitive
Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Whether the comparison operation is diacritic sensitive

Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: locale
Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The locale argument specifies the IETF language tag of the locale to use.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: locale
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Specifies the locale to use, as a BCP 47 language tag.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: currency
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Specifies an ISO 4217 code to use for currency-style formatting.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: minFractionDigits
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Minimum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: maxFractionDigits
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Maximum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: fontScale
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Applies a scaling factor on text-size as specified by the root layout property.

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: textFont
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Overrides the font stack specified by the root layout property.

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: textColor
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Overrides the color specified by the root paint property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: subtract
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: For two inputs, returns the result of subtracting the second input from the first. For a single input, returns the result of subtracting it from 0.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: not
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Logical negation. Returns true if the input is false, and false if the input is true.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: neq
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the input values are not equal, false otherwise. The comparison is strictly typed: values of different runtime types are always considered unequal. Cases where the types are known to be different at parse time are considered invalid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: product
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the product of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: division
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the result of floating point division of the first input by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: mod
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the remainder after integer division of the first input by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: pow
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the result of raising the first input to the power specified by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: sum
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the sum of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: lt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is strictly less than the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: lte
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is less than or equal to the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: eq
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the input values are equal, false otherwise. The comparison is strictly typed: values of different runtime types are always considered unequal. Cases where the types are known to be different at parse time are considered invalid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: gt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is strictly greater than the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: gte
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: abs
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the absolute value of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: accumulated
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the value of a cluster property accumulated so far. Can only be used in the clusterProperties option of a clustered GeoJSON source.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: acos
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the arccosine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: activeAnchor
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a string which matches one of the values specified in the text-anchor layout property, depending on the best-fit anchor for the symbol during rendering. Using this expression the content of the layer can be dynamically configured for the specific anchor type.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: all
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if all the inputs are true, false otherwise. The inputs are evaluated in order, and evaluation is short-circuiting: once an input expression evaluates to false, the result is false and no further input expressions are evaluated.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: any
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if any of the inputs are true, false otherwise. The inputs are evaluated in order, and evaluation is short-circuiting: once an input expression evaluates to true, the result is true and no further input expressions are evaluated.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: array
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input is an array (optionally with a specific item type and length). If, when the input expression is evaluated, it is not of the asserted type, then this assertion will cause the whole expression to be aborted.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: asin
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the arcsine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: at
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Retrieves an item from an array.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: atan
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the arctangent of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: boolean
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a boolean. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a boolean is obtained. If none of the inputs are booleans, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: switchCase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Selects the first output whose corresponding test condition evaluates to true, or the fallback value otherwise.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: ceil
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: coalesce
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Evaluates each expression in turn until the first valid value is obtained. Invalid values are null and 'image' expressions that are unavailable in the style. If all values are invalid, coalesce returns the first value listed.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: collator
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a collator for use in locale-dependent comparison operations. The case-sensitive and diacritic-sensitive options default to false. The locale argument specifies the IETF language tag of the locale to use. If none is provided, the default locale is used. If the requested locale is not available, the collator will use a system-defined fallback locale. Use resolved-locale to test the results of locale fallback behavior.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: concat
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a string consisting of the concatenation of the inputs. Each input is converted to a string as if by to-string.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: config
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Retrieves the configuration value for the given option.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: cos
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the cosine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: distance
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the shortest distance in meters between the evaluated feature and the input geometry. The input value can be a valid GeoJSON of type Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon, Feature, or FeatureCollection. Distance values returned may vary in precision due to loss in precision from encoding geometries, particularly below zoom level 13.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: distanceFromCenter
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the distance of a symbol instance from the center of the map. The distance is measured in pixels divided by the height of the map container. It measures 0 at the center, decreases towards the camera and increase away from the camera. For example, if the height of the map is 1000px, a value of -1 means 1000px away from the center towards the camera, and a value of 1 means a distance of 1000px away from the camera from the center. ["distance-from-center"] may only be used in the filter expression for a symbol layer.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: downcase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the input string converted to lowercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: e
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the mathematical constant e.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: featureState
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Retrieves a property value from the current feature’s state. Returns null if the requested property is not present on the feature’s state. A feature’s state is not part of the GeoJSON or vector tile data, and must be set programmatically on each feature. Features are identified by their id attribute, which must be an integer or a string that can be cast to an integer. Note that [“feature-state”] can only be used with paint properties that support data-driven styling.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: floor
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: format
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a formatted string for displaying mixed-format text in the text-field property. The input may contain a string literal or expression, including an 'image' expression. Strings may be followed by a style override object that supports the following properties:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: geometryType
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the feature’s geometry type: Point, LineString or Polygon. Multi* feature types return the singular forms.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: get
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Retrieves a property value from the current feature’s properties, or from another object if a second argument is provided. Returns null if the requested property is missing.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: has
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Tests for the presence of an property value in the current feature’s properties, or from another object if a second argument is provided.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: heatmapDensity
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the kernel density estimation of a pixel in a heatmap layer, which is a relative measure of how many data points are crowded around a particular pixel. Can only be used in the heatmap-color property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: hsl
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Creates a color value from hue (range 0-360), saturation and lightness components (range 0-100), and an alpha component of 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: hsla
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Creates a color value from hue (range 0-360), saturation and lightness components (range 0-100), and an alpha component (range 0-1). If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: id
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the feature’s id, if it has one.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: image
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a ResolvedImage for use in icon-image, *-pattern entries, and as a section in the 'format' expression. A 'coalesce' expression containing image expressions will evaluate to the first listed image that is currently in the style. This validation process is synchronous and requires the image to have been added to the style before requesting it in the 'image' argument.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: inExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Determines whether an item exists in an array or a substring exists in a string. In the specific case when the second and third arguments are string literals, you must wrap at least one of them in a literal expression to hint correct interpretation to the type system.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: indexOf
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the first position at which an item can be found in an array or a substring can be found in a string, or -1 if the input cannot be found. Accepts an optional index from where to begin the search.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: interpolate
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Produces continuous, smooth results by interpolating between pairs of input and output values (“stops”). The input may be any numeric expression (e.g., ["get", "population"]). Stop inputs must be numeric literals in strictly ascending order. The output type must be number, array<number>, or color.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: isSupportedScript
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the input string is expected to render legibly. Returns false if the input string contains sections that cannot be rendered without potential loss of meaning (e.g. Indic scripts that require complex text shaping, or right-to-left scripts if the the mapbox-gl-rtl-text plugin is not in use in Mapbox GL JS).

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: length
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the length of an array or string.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: letExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Binds expressions to named variables, which can then be referenced in the result expression using [“var”, “variable_name”].

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: lineProgress
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the progress along a gradient line. Can only be used in the line-gradient property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: literal
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Provides a literal array or object value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: ln
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the natural logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: ln2
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns mathematical constant ln(2).

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: log10
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the base-ten logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: log2
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the base-two logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: match
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Selects the output for which the label value matches the input value, or the fallback value if no match is found. The input can be any expression (for example, ["get", "building_type"]). Each label must be unique, and must be either:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: max
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the maximum value of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: measureLight
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a requested property of the light configuration based on the supplied options. Currently the only supported option is brightness which returns the global brightness value of the lights on a scale of 0 to 1, where 0 means total darkness and 1 means full brightness. This expression works only with 3D light, i.e. when lights root property is defined.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: min
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the minimum value of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: number
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a number. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a number is obtained. If none of the inputs are numbers, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: numberFormat
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input number into a string representation using the providing formatting rules. If set, the locale argument specifies the locale to use, as a BCP 47 language tag. If set, the currency argument specifies an ISO 4217 code to use for currency-style formatting. If set, the unit argument specifies a simple ECMAScript unit to use for unit-style formatting. If set, the min and max arguments specify the minimum and maximum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: objectExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is an object. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until an object is obtained. If none of the inputs are objects, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: pi
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the mathematical constant pi.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: pitch
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the current pitch in degrees. ["pitch"] may only be used in the filter expression for a symbol layer.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: properties
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the feature properties object. Note that in some cases, it may be more efficient to use ["get", "property_name"] directly.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: random
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a random value in the specified range (first two input numbers) based on a supplied seed (third input). The seed can be an expression or a constant number or string value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: rasterValue
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the raster value of a pixel computed via raster-color-mix. Can only be used in the raster-color property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: resolvedLocale
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the IETF language tag of the locale being used by the provided collator. This can be used to determine the default system locale, or to determine if a requested locale was successfully loaded.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: rgb
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Creates a color value from red, green, and blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component of 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: rgba
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Creates a color value from red, green, blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component which must range between 0 and 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: round
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Rounds the input to the nearest integer. Halfway values are rounded away from zero. For example, ["round", -1.5] evaluates to -2.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: sin
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the sine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: skyRadialProgress
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the distance of a point on the sky from the sun position. Returns 0 at sun position and 1 when the distance reaches sky-gradient-radius. Can only be used in the sky-gradient property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: slice
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns an item from an array or a substring from a string from a specified start index, or between a start index and an end index if set. The return value is inclusive of the start index but not of the end index.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: sqrt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the square root of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: step
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Produces discrete, stepped results by evaluating a piecewise-constant function defined by pairs of input and output values (“stops”). The input may be any numeric expression (e.g., ["get", "population"]). Stop inputs must be numeric literals in strictly ascending order. Returns the output value of the stop just less than the input, or the first output if the input is less than the first stop.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: string
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a string. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a string is obtained. If none of the inputs are strings, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: tan
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the tangent of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toBoolean
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a boolean. The result is false when then input is an empty string, 0, false, null, or NaN; otherwise it is true.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toColor
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a color. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until the first successful conversion is obtained. If none of the inputs can be converted, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toNumber
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a number, if possible. If the input is null or false, the result is 0. If the input is true, the result is 1. If the input is a string, it is converted to a number as specified by the “ToNumber Applied to the String Type” algorithm of the ECMAScript Language Specification. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until the first successful conversion is obtained. If none of the inputs can be converted, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toRgba
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a four-element array containing the input color’s red, green, blue, and alpha components, in that order.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toString
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a string. If the input is null, the result is "". If the input is a boolean, the result is "true" or "false". If the input is a number, it is converted to a string as specified by the “NumberToString” algorithm of the ECMAScript Language Specification. If the input is a color, it is converted to a string of the form "rgba(r,g,b,a)", where r, g, and b are numerals ranging from 0 to 255, and a ranges from 0 to 1. If the input is an 'image' expression, 'to-string' returns the image name. Otherwise, the input is converted to a string in the format specified by the JSON.stringify function of the ECMAScript Language Specification.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: typeofExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a string describing the type of the given value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: upcase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the input string converted to uppercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: varExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: References variable bound using “let”.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: within
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the evaluated feature is fully contained inside a boundary of the input geometry, false otherwise. The input value can be a valid GeoJSON of type Polygon, MultiPolygon, Feature, or FeatureCollection. Supported features for evaluation:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: zoom
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the current zoom level. Note that in style layout and paint properties, [“zoom”] may only appear as the input to a top-level “step” or “interpolate” expression.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: linear
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Interpolates linearly between the pair of stops just less than and just greater than the input

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: exponential
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: ["exponential", base]

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: cubicBezier
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: ["cubic-bezier", x1, y1, x2, y2]

Structs/Expression.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: init(operator:arguments:)
