Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: fillOutlineColor
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of fill-color if unspecified.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: fillOutlineColorTransition
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Transition options for fillOutlineColor.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: fillPattern
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: fillTranslate
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: fillTranslateTransition
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Transition options for fillTranslate.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: fillTranslateAnchor
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Controls the frame of reference for fill-translate.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: init(id:source:)
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: id
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Unique layer name

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: type
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Rendering type of this layer.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: filter
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: An expression specifying conditions on source features.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: source
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Name of a source description to be used for this layer.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: sourceLayer
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Layer to use from a vector tile source.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: slot
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The slot this layer is assigned to. If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: minZoom
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: maxZoom
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: visibility
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Whether this layer is displayed.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionEdgeRadius
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Radius of a fill extrusion edge in meters. If not zero, rounds extrusion edges for a smoother appearance.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionGroundAttenuation
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Provides a control to futher fine-tune the look of the ambient occlusion on the ground beneath the extruded buildings. Lower values give the effect a more solid look while higher values make it smoother.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionGroundAttenuationTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionGroundAttenuation.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionGroundRadius
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The extent of the ambient occlusion effect on the ground beneath the extruded buildings in meters.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionGroundRadiusTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionGroundRadius.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionIntensity
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Controls the intensity of shading near ground and concave angles between walls. Default value 0.0 disables ambient occlusion and values around 0.3 provide the most plausible results for buildings.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionIntensityTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionIntensity.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionRadius
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Shades area near ground and concave angles between walls where the radius defines only vertical impact. Default value 3.0 corresponds to height of one floor and brings the most plausible results for buildings. This property works only with legacy light. When 3D lights are enabled fill-extrusion-ambient-occlusion-wall-radius and fill-extrusion-ambient-occlusion-ground-radius are used instead.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionRadiusTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionRadius.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionWallRadius
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Shades area near ground and concave angles between walls where the radius defines only vertical impact. Default value 3.0 corresponds to height of one floor and brings the most plausible results for buildings.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionWallRadiusTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionAmbientOcclusionWallRadius.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionBase
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The height with which to extrude the base of this layer. Must be less than or equal to fill-extrusion-height.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionBaseTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionBase.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionColor
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The base color of the extruded fill. The extrusion’s surfaces will be shaded differently based on this color in combination with the root light settings. If this color is specified as rgba with an alpha component, the alpha component will be ignored; use fill-extrusion-opacity to set layer opacity.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionColorTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionColor.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionCutoffFadeRange
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: This parameter defines the range for the fade-out effect before an automatic content cutoff on pitched map views. The automatic cutoff range is calculated according to the minimum required zoom level of the source and layer. The fade range is expressed in relation to the height of the map view. A value of 1.0 indicates that the content is faded to the same extent as the map’s height in pixels, while a value close to zero represents a sharp cutoff. When the value is set to 0.0, the cutoff is completely disabled. Note: The property has no effect on the map if terrain is enabled.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionEmissiveStrength
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionEmissiveStrengthTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionEmissiveStrength.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightColor
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The color of the flood light effect on the walls of the extruded buildings.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightColorTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionFloodLightColor.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightGroundAttenuation
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Provides a control to futher fine-tune the look of the flood light on the ground beneath the extruded buildings. Lower values give the effect a more solid look while higher values make it smoother.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightGroundAttenuationTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionFloodLightGroundAttenuation.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightGroundRadius
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The extent of the flood light effect on the ground beneath the extruded buildings in meters.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightGroundRadiusTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionFloodLightGroundRadius.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightIntensity
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The intensity of the flood light color.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightIntensityTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionFloodLightIntensity.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightWallRadius
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The extent of the flood light effect on the walls of the extruded buildings in meters.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionFloodLightWallRadiusTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionFloodLightWallRadius.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionHeight
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The height with which to extrude this layer.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionHeightTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionHeight.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionOpacity
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The opacity of the entire fill extrusion layer. This is rendered on a per-layer, not per-feature, basis, and data-driven styling is not available.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionOpacityTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionOpacity.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionPattern
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing images on extruded fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionRoundedRoof
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Indicates whether top edges should be rounded when fill-extrusion-edge-radius has a value greater than 0. If false, rounded edges are only applied to the sides. Default is true.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionTranslate
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up (on the flat plane), respectively.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionTranslateTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionTranslate.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionTranslateAnchor
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Controls the frame of reference for fill-extrusion-translate.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionVerticalGradient
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Whether to apply a vertical gradient to the sides of a fill-extrusion layer. If true, sides will be shaded slightly darker farther down.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionVerticalScale
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: A global multiplier that can be used to scale base, height, AO, and flood light of the fill extrusions.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: fillExtrusionVerticalScaleTransition
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Transition options for fillExtrusionVerticalScale.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: init(id:source:)
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: filter
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: An expression specifying conditions on source features.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: source
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Name of a source description to be used for this layer.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: sourceLayer
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Layer to use from a vector tile source.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: slot
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: The slot this layer is assigned to. If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: minZoom
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: maxZoom
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circleSortKey
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circleBlur
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circleEmissiveStrength
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circleOpacity
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: The opacity at which the circle will be drawn.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circlePitchAlignment
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circlePitchScale
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circleStrokeWidth
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: The width of the circle’s stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the circle-radius.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: circleTranslate
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: slot
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The slot this layer is assigned to. If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: minZoom
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: maxZoom
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: backgroundColor
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The color with which the background will be drawn.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: backgroundEmissiveStrength
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: backgroundOpacity
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The opacity at which the background will be drawn.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: backgroundPattern
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: rawValue
Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: The raw value of the layer type.

Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: fill
Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.

Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: raster
Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.

Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: hillshade
Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data.

Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: background
Structs/LayerType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: The background color or pattern of the map.

Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.name: minZoom
Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.abstract: The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.name: maxZoom
Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.abstract: The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.name: slot
Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.abstract: The slot this layer is assigned to. If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.

Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.name: init(jsonObject:)
Protocols/Layer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Lay.abstract: Initializes a Layer given a JSON dictionary

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html.name: BackgroundLayer
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html.abstract: The background color or pattern of the map.

Structs/FillLayer.html.name: FillLayer
Structs/FillLayer.html.abstract: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html.name: HillshadeLayer
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html.abstract: Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.

Structs/RasterLayer.html.name: RasterLayer
Structs/RasterLayer.html.abstract: Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.

Structs/SkyLayer.html.name: SkyLayer
Structs/SkyLayer.html.abstract: A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.

Structs/Encoding.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8En.name: terrarium
Structs/Encoding.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8En.abstract: Terrarium format PNG tiles. See https://aws.amazon.com/es/public-datasets/terrain/ for more info.

Structs/Encoding.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8En.name: mapbox
Structs/Encoding.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8En.abstract: Mapbox Terrain RGB tiles. See https://www.mapbox.com/help/access-elevation-data/#mapbox-terrain-rgb for more info.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: url
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tiles
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: bounds
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: scheme
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minzoom
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxzoom
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: attribution
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: promoteId
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form {<sourceLayer>: <propertyName>}. If specified as a string for a vector tile source, the same property is used across all its source layers. If specified as an object only specified source layers will have id overriden, others will fallback to original feature id

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: volatile
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tileCacheBudget
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minimumTileUpdateInterval
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum tile update interval in seconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests. If the given source supports loading tiles from a server, sets the minimum tile update interval. Update network requests that are more frequent than the minimum tile update interval are suppressed.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxOverscaleFactorForParentTiles
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tileRequestsDelay
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading, parsing and rendering of the transient tiles and thus to improve the rendering performance, especially on low-end devices.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tileNetworkRequestsDelay
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile network requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading the transient tiles from the network and thus to avoid redundant network requests. Note that tile-network-requests-delay value is superseded with tile-requests-delay property value, if both are provided.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: url
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tiles
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: bounds
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minzoom
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxzoom
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tileSize
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: scheme
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: attribution
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: volatile
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tileCacheBudget
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minimumTileUpdateInterval
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum tile update interval in seconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests. If the given source supports loading tiles from a server, sets the minimum tile update interval. Update network requests that are more frequent than the minimum tile update interval are suppressed.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxOverscaleFactorForParentTiles
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tileRequestsDelay
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading, parsing and rendering of the transient tiles and thus to improve the rendering performance, especially on low-end devices.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile network requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading the transient tiles from the network and thus to avoid redundant network requests. Note that tile-network-requests-delay value is superseded with tile-requests-delay property value, if both are provided.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: url
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: tiles
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: bounds
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: minzoom
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: maxzoom
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: tileSize
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: attribution
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: encoding
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The encoding used by this source. Mapbox Terrain RGB is used by default

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: volatile
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

If the given source supports loading tiles from a server, sets the minimum tile update interval. Update network requests that are more frequent than the minimum tile update interval are suppressed.

This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: tileRequestsDelay
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading, parsing and rendering of the transient tiles and thus to improve the rendering performance, especially on low-end devices.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile network requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading the transient tiles from the network and thus to avoid redundant network requests. Note that tile-network-requests-delay value is superseded with tile-requests-delay property value, if both are provided.

Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: url
Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: URL that points to an image. If the URL is not specified, the image is expected to be loaded directly during runtime.

Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: coordinates
Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Corners of image specified in longitude, latitude pairs. Note: When using globe projection, the image will be centered at the North or South Pole in the respective hemisphere if the average latitude value exceeds 85 degrees or falls below -85 degrees.

Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: string(_:)
Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The data property can be an URL or inlined GeoJSON string.

Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: featureCollection(_:)
Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The data property can be a feature collection.

Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: geometry(_:)
Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The data property can be a geometry with no associated properties.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: data
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: A URL to a GeoJSON file, or inline GeoJSON.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: maxzoom
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Maximum zoom level at which to create vector tiles (higher means greater detail at high zoom levels).

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: attribution
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: buffer
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Size of the tile buffer on each side. A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself. Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: tolerance
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance (higher means simpler geometries and faster performance).

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: cluster
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: If the data is a collection of point features, setting this to true clusters the points by radius into groups. Cluster groups become new Point features in the source with additional properties:

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: clusterRadius
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled. A value of 512 indicates a radius equal to the width of a tile.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: clusterMaxZoom
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Max zoom on which to cluster points if clustering is enabled. Defaults to one zoom less than maxzoom (so that last zoom features are not clustered). Clusters are re-evaluated at integer zoom levels so setting clusterMaxZoom to 14 means the clusters will be displayed until z15.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: clusterProperties
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: An object defining custom properties on the generated clusters if clustering is enabled, aggregating values from clustered points. Has the form {"property_name": [operator, map_expression]}. operator is any expression function that accepts at least 2 operands (e.g. "+" or "max") â€” it accumulates the property value from clusters/points the cluster contains; map_expression produces the value of a single point.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: lineMetrics
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Whether to calculate line distance metrics. This is required for line layers that specify line-gradient values.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: generateId
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Whether to generate ids for the geojson features. When enabled, the feature.id property will be auto assigned based on its index in the features array, over-writing any previous values.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: promoteId
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form {<sourceLayer>: <propertyName>}.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: tileCacheBudget
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

Structs/SourceType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: rawValue
Structs/SourceType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: The raw value of the source type.

Protocols/Source.html#/s:10MapboxMaps6So.name: init(jsonObject:)
Protocols/Source.html#/s:10MapboxMaps6So.abstract: Initializes a Source given a JSON dictionary

Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html.name: GeoJSONSourceData
Enums/GeoJSONSourceData.html.abstract: Captures potential values of the data property of a GeoJSONSource.

Structs/Scheme.html.name: Scheme
Structs/Scheme.html.abstract: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

Structs/Encoding.html.name: Encoding
Structs/Encoding.html.abstract: The encoding used by this source. Mapbox Terrain RGB is used by default

Structs/LightType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: directional
Structs/LightType.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: A type of light that has a direction.

Structs/FlatLight.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: anchor
Structs/FlatLight.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Whether extruded geometries are lit relative to the map or viewport.

Structs/FlatLight.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: intensity
Structs/FlatLight.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Intensity of lighting (on a scale from 0 to 1). Higher numbers will present as more extreme contrast.

Structs/FlatLight.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: position
Structs/FlatLight.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Position of the light source relative to lit (extruded) geometries, in [r radial coordinate, a azimuthal angle, p polar angle] where r indicates the distance from the center of the base of an object to its light, a indicates the position of the light relative to 0 degree (0 degree when light.anchor is set to viewport corresponds to the top of the viewport, or 0 degree when light.anchor is set to map corresponds to due north, and degrees proceed clockwise), and p indicates the height of the light (from 0 degree, directly above, to 180 degree, directly below).

Structs/DirectionalLight.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: direction
Structs/DirectionalLight.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Direction of the light source specified as [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle] where a indicates the azimuthal angle of the light relative to north (in degrees and proceeding clockwise), and p indicates polar angle of the light (from 0 degree, directly above, to 180 degree, directly below).

Structs/DirectionalLight.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: intensity
Structs/DirectionalLight.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: A multiplier for the color of the directional light.

Structs/DirectionalLight.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: shadowIntensity
Structs/DirectionalLight.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Determines the shadow strength, affecting the shadow receiver surfaces final color. Values near 0.0 reduce the shadow contribution to the final color. Values near to 1.0 make occluded surfaces receive almost no directional light. Designed to be used mostly for transitioning between values 0 and 1.

Structs/AmbientLight.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: intensity
Structs/AmbientLight.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A multiplier for the color of the ambient light.

Structs/AmbientLight.html.name: AmbientLight
Structs/AmbientLight.html.abstract: An indirect light affecting all objects in the map adding a constant amount of light on them. It has no explicit direction and cannot cast shadows.

Structs/DirectionalLight.html.name: DirectionalLight
Structs/DirectionalLight.html.abstract: A light that has a direction and is located at infinite distance, so its rays are parallel. It simulates the sun light and can cast shadows.

Structs/FlatLight.html.name: FlatLight
Structs/FlatLight.html.abstract: A global directional light source which is only applied on 3D and hillshade layers. Using this type disables other light sources.

Structs/TypeConversionError.html#/s:10Ma.name: invalidObject
Structs/TypeConversionError.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: The object is invalid for this operation

Protocols/StyleEncodable.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: jsonObject()
Protocols/StyleEncodable.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Converts this object to a dictionary representation

Protocols/StyleEncodable.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: allStyleProperties()
Protocols/StyleEncodable.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Encodes the receiver into a Dictionary representation.

Protocols/StyleDecodable.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: init(jsonObject:)
Protocols/StyleDecodable.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Initializes this object from a dictionary representation.

Structs/StyleProjectionName.html#/s:10Ma.name: mercator
Structs/StyleProjectionName.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: The Mercator projection is the default projection.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: color
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: The color of the atmosphere region immediately below the horizon and within the range and above the horizon and within horizon-blend. Using opacity is recommended only for smoothly transitioning fog on/off as anything less than 100% opacity results in more tiles loaded and drawn.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: highColor
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: The color of the atmosphere region above the horizon, high-color extends further above the horizon than the color property and its spread can be controlled with horizon-blend. The opacity can be set to 0 to remove the high atmosphere color contribution.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: horizonBlend
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: Horizon blend applies a smooth fade from the color of the atmosphere to the color of space. A value of zero leaves a sharp transition from atmosphere to space. Increasing the value blends the color of atmosphere into increasingly high angles of the sky.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: range
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: The start and end distance range in which fog fades from fully transparent to fully opaque. The distance to the point at the center of the map is defined as zero, so that negative range values are closer to the camera, and positive values are farther away.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: spaceColor
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: The color of the region above the horizon and after the end of the horizon-blend contribution. The opacity can be set to 0 to have a transparent background.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: starIntensity
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: A value controlling the star intensity where 0 will show no stars and 1 will show stars at their maximum intensity.

Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: verticalRange
Structs/Atmosphere.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: An array of two number values, specifying the vertical range, measured in meters, over which the fog should gradually fade out. When both parameters are set to zero, the fog will be rendered without any vertical constraints.

Structs/Terrain.html#/s:10MapboxMaps7Ter.name: exaggeration
Structs/Terrain.html#/s:10MapboxMaps7Ter.abstract: Exaggerates the elevation of the terrain by multiplying the data from the DEM with this value.

Extensions/TransitionOptions.html#/s:So2.name: duration
Extensions/TransitionOptions.html#/s:So2.abstract: Time allotted for transitions to complete. Defaults to 0.3 seconds.

Extensions/TransitionOptions.html#/s:So2.name: delay
